div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, May 30, 1919. SMALL TOWN NEWS

body.p: More than 2,000 men, women, and children took part yesterday evening in a "neighborhood reception" for Colonel Abel Davis, commander of the 132 infantry regiment, which took place in the street in front of his home at 5125 Ellis Ave. The street was decorated and illuminated with white and blue lanterns. From a grandly decorated platform, set up for the occasion, Judges McGurtie, Holmes, McSurley, Horner, Trude, and Holdom, addressed the crowd. All the judges lauded the Colonel.

Colonel Davis was presented with a set of diamond shirt studs and cuff-links, bought with a fund gathered in the neighborhood. A balance of $2,000 presented to the Colonel will be used by him for a Regimental Fund, if a permanent organization is established.
A public reception is being planned for Colonel Davis by West Side Jews.
